current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To ensure the compliance of Iran with agreements relating to Iran's nuclear program.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not, in connection with the ongoing nuclear negotiations with Iran, exercise a waiver of, suspend, or otherwise reduce any sanctions imposed in relation to Iran, whether imposed directly by statute or through an Executive order, unless, not later than 15 days before the waiver, suspension, or other reduction takes effect, the
submits to the appropriate congressional committees the certification described in

text.#text: During the 240-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The certification described in this paragraph is a certification with respect to the waiver, suspension, or other reduction of sanctions under
it is in the vital national security interests of the United States to waive, suspend, or otherwise reduce those sanctions; and
Iran is in full compliance with the terms of any interim agreement between the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Russia, China, Germany, and Iran relating to Iran’s nuclear program.

Any sanctions imposed in relation to Iran that have been waived, suspended, or otherwise reduced in connection with the ongoing nuclear negotiations with Iran, regardless whether the waiver, suspension, or other reduction of those sanctions took effect before or after the date of the enactment of this Act, shall be immediately reinstated on the date that is 240 days after such date of enactment.

header.#text: Expiration of interim relief and reinstatement of sanctions
Effective enforcement of final agreement and limitations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not, in connection with the ongoing nuclear negotiations with Iran, exercise a waiver of, suspend, or otherwise reduce any sanctions imposed in relation to Iran, whether imposed directly by statute or through an Executive order, unless, not later than 15 days before the waiver, suspension, or other reduction takes effect, the
submits to the appropriate congressional committees the certification described in

text.#text: On and after the date that is 240 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The certification described in this paragraph is a certification that—
the conditions for a temporary waiver, suspension, or other reduction of sanctions pursuant to
Iran is in full compliance with the terms of all agreements between the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Russia, China, Germany, and Iran relating to Iran’s nuclear program;
Iran is in full compliance with terms of United Nations Security Council Resolutions 1696 (2006), 1737 (2006), 1747 (2007), 1803 (2008), 1835 (2008), and 1929 (2010); and
Iran has provided a full accounting of all of its nuclear weaponization and related activities, has committed, in writing, to suspend all such activities, and is making substantial efforts to do so.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: receives information from any person, including the

, that Iran has failed to comply with the terms of any agreement between the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Russia, China, Germany, and Iran with respect to Iran’s nuclear program or has refused to cooperate in any way with appropriate requests of the

text.#text: not later than 10 days after receiving that information, determine whether the information is credible and accurate;
notify the appropriate congressional committees of that determination; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines that the information is credible and accurate, not later than 5 days after making that determination, reinstate all sanctions imposed in relation to Iran that have been waived, suspended, or otherwise reduced in connection with the ongoing nuclear negotiations with Iran, without regard to whether the waiver, suspension, or other reduction of those sanctions took effect before or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 14 of the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996
